page.title: 09Grindleford Station
page.content: The construction of the Midland Railway Sheffield to Manchester line through the Hope Valley was the last major trans Pennine rail route to be completed. The line was opened to traffic in 1893. The principal engineering features of the line were Cowburn Tunnel (3,702 yds long) to the west of Edale village and Totley Tunnel (6,230 yds long) at the eastern end of the valley. In 1985 the latter is the longest railway tunnel in the United Kingdom. At the Western portal of the tunnel is Grindleford Station situated in Padley woods, but over one mile from the heart of the village. Today the station is unstaffed and served each weekday by 19 passenger trains travelling between Sheffield and New Mills.
